name: Administrative Building Quest
title: The Director's Challenge
description: Navigate through the historic Administrative Building of MNNIT, discovering its architectural secrets and rich heritage through challenging puzzles.

locations.name: Main Entrance
locations.hint: Look for the foundation stone near the grand steps.

locations.name: Director's Office Wing
locations.hint: Find the display board showing past directors.

locations.name: Conference Hall
locations.hint: The ceremonial bell holds a clue.

clues.text: Add the digits of the year when MNNIT got its NIT status. Divide by 2 to proceed.
How many directors' photos are displayed in golden frames on the heritage wall?
Count the pillars at the main entrance, multiply by windows on the front facade, divide by 4.

name: Cafe69 Adventure
title: Culinary Code Quest
description: Explore MNNIT's favorite hangout spot, Cafe69, where food meets fun in this exciting treasure hunt.

locations.name: Menu Wall
locations.hint: Check the special menu board near the counter.

locations.name: Seating Area
locations.hint: Look for the table with carved initials.

locations.name: Garden Section
locations.hint: Find the oldest banyan tree near the outdoor seating.

clues.text: What's the price of the most popular combo meal divided by 10?
Count the number of ceiling fans in the main seating area, multiply by 2.
How many stone benches are there in the garden section?

name: Central Library Mystery
title: Knowledge Navigator
description: Dive into the vast repository of knowledge at MNNIT's Central Library, where books hold more than just information.

locations.name: Reference Section
locations.hint: Start at the Engineering Mathematics shelf.

locations.name: Digital Library
locations.hint: Check the computer with terminal number matching today's date.

locations.name: Reading Hall
locations.hint: Find the largest study table near the window.

clues.text: On the first bookshelf of Engineering Mathematics, add the edition numbers of all Kreyszig books on display.
What floor number has the IEEE journal section? Multiply by the number of computer labs.
Count the number of ceiling lights in the main reading hall, divide by the number of emergency exits.
